title: Fire Emblem Heroes Summoning Simulator
text: basic example shows solve common problem: ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(feh) ## basic example code set.seed(1)  sesh <- session(matrix(c(15,27,25,0,                  12,23,17,1,                  9,18,12,1,                  13,23,16,2),4,4,byrow=T),          baserate=0.03, rateups=0, targetcol="Red", targetrar="5*F")  print(sesh) #>      Rarity Colour  Target #> [1,] "4*"   "Grey"  "0"    #> [2,] "4*"   "Grey"  "0"    #> [3,] "3*"   "Green" "0"    #> [4,] "3*"   "Green" "0"    #> [5,] "4*"   "Red"   "0"

text: Produces orb cost distribution based user's desired outcomes.

title: feh: Fire Emblem Heroes Summoning Simulator — feh-package
Generate summoning session — session
text: herocounts 4x4 matrix containing colour x rarity counts baserate Decimal initial 5* appearance rate rateups Integer number times pity increased targetcol Colour desired character targetrar Rarity desired character
